# Note S1 Models

Here, we describe five alternative models of (1) LMA, (2) LMAm and LMAs, (3) LMA and light, (4) LMAm, LMAs and light, and (5) LMAm, LMAs, LT and light.

## LMA model

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\mathrm{(Model \; 1)}\; \; \; \;  A_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \alpha_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\alpha_1} \epsilon_{1i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 1)}\; \; \; \; LL_i = \beta_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\beta_1} \epsilon_{2i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 1)}\; \; \; \;R_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \gamma_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\gamma_3} \epsilon_{3i}\\
\end{array}
$$

## LMAm and LMAs

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\mathrm{(Model \; 2)}\; \; \; \;  A_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \alpha_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\alpha_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\alpha_s}\epsilon_{1i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 2)}\; \; \; \; LL_i = \beta_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\beta_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\beta_s}\epsilon_{2i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 2)}\; \; \; \;  R_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \gamma_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\gamma_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\gamma_s}\epsilon_{3i}\\
\end{array}
$$

## LMA and light

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\mathrm{(Model \; 3)}\; \; \; \;  A_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \alpha_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\alpha_1} exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{1i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 3)}\; \; \; \; LL_i = \beta_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\beta_1} exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{2i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 3)}\; \; \; \;R_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \gamma_0\mathrm{LMA}_{i}^{\gamma_3} exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{3i}\\
\end{array}
$$

## LMAm, LMAs and light

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\mathrm{(Model \; 4)}\; \; \; \;  A_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \alpha_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\alpha_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\alpha_s} exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{1i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 4)}\; \; \; \; LL_i = \beta_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\beta_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\beta_s}exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{2i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 4)}\; \; \; \;  R_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \gamma_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\gamma_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\gamma_s}exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{3i}\\
\end{array}
$$

## LMAm, LMAs, LT and light

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\mathrm{(Model \; 5)}\; \; \; \;  A_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \alpha_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\alpha_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\alpha_s} exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{1i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 5)}\; \; \; \; LL_i = \beta_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\beta_m} \mathrm{(LMAs_i/LT_i)}^{\beta_s}exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{2i}\\
\mathrm{(Model \; 5)}\; \; \; \;  R_{\mathrm{area} \; i}
= \gamma_0\mathrm{LMAm}_{i}^{\gamma_m} \mathrm{LMAs}_{i}^{\gamma_s}exp(\theta L_i)\epsilon_{3i}\\
\end{array}
$$

The logarithms of *A*~area~, LL, and *R*~area~ are assumed to have a multivariate normal distribution (MVN):

$$
\left(
\begin{array}{ccc}
\mathrm{ln}[A_{\mathrm{area} \, i}]&\\
\mathrm{ln}[\mathrm{LL}_i]&\\
\mathrm{ln}[R_{\mathrm{area} \, i}]&
\end{array}
\right)
\sim \mathrm{MVN}
\left(
\begin{array}{ccc}
\mu_{1i}&\\
\mu_{2i}&, \boldsymbol{\Sigma}\\
\mu_{3i}&
\end{array}
\right)
$$

$$
\boldsymbol{\Sigma} =
\left(
\begin{array}{ccc}
\sigma_1^2 &\rho_{12}\sigma_1\sigma_2 &\rho_{13}\sigma_1\sigma_3 \\
\rho_{12}\sigma_1\sigma_2&\sigma_2^2 &\rho_{23}\sigma_2\sigma_3 \\
\rho_{13}\sigma_1\sigma_3&\rho_{23}\sigma_2\sigma_3 &\sigma_3^2
\end{array}
\right) (\#eq:Sigma)
$$

where $\mu_{1-3,i}$ is the expecation on the log scale; i.g., $\mu_{1i} = \mathrm{ln}\alpha_0 + \alpha_1 \mathrm{ln\; LMA}_i + \sigma_1^2/2$ for Model 1; $\boldsymbol{\Sigma}$ is the covariance matrix; $\sigma_1$, $\sigma_2$, and $\sigma_3$ are standard deviations of $\mu_{1-3}$.
